sentences.sContent: It could be resistivity, if you have a thermocouple.
sentences.sContent_eng: It could be resistivity, if you have a thermocouple.
sentences.sCn: 如果你有个热电偶，它也可以是电阻率。

sentences.sContent: "In the sole of the Wellington boot there's a thermocouple and if you apply heat to one side of the thermocouple and cold to the other side it generates an electrical charge, " Pain said.
sentences.sContent_eng: "In the sole of the Wellington boot there's a thermocouple and if you apply heat to one side of the thermocouple and cold to the other side it generates an electrical charge, " Pain said.
sentences.sCn: 佩恩说：“长筒靴的鞋底处有一个热电偶，如果电偶的一面受热，而另一面受冷，就会产生电荷。”

sentences.sContent: The sample temperature was controlled by a Chromel_Alumel thermocouple with a precision on the order of 0.1℃.
sentences.sContent_eng: The sample temperature was controlled by a Chromel_Alumel thermocouple with a precision on the order of 0.1℃.
sentences.sCn: 样品温度用Chromel-Alumel热电偶控制，其精度在0.1℃左右。

words.tran: 热电子的，[物] 热离子的
[电] 温差电学，[物] 热电学

trans.tranOther: a device for measuring temperature consisting of a pair of wires of different metals or semiconductors joined at both ends. One junction is at the temperature to be measured, the second at a fixed temperature. The electromotive force generated depends upon the temperature difference
